scenarioDescription:
The SWEEPS-4 Exoplanetary System


Overview

SWEEPS-4 is a star with 1.24 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.18 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

SWEEPS-4 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the SWEEPS-4 system


SWEEPS-4 b

SWEEPS-4 b was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope observatory, in 2006-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of SWEEPS-4 b is 1208.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of SWEEPS-4 b is 9.079 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, SWEEPS-4 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system SWEEPS-4, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope.
name: SWEEPS-4 - System With 1 Exoplanet
